card.description: Patriots Against Corrupt Election Results - PACER Keeps you on top of new developments, rhetoric, and activism regarding voter fraud and election integrity issues
card.title: Commentary

_source.content: 2/23/23 - ERIC: The Worm That Got Inside Our ElectionsLinks at http://www.liberato.us/commentary.htmlGrassroots activists continue to raise questions about ERIC, the Electronic Registration Information Center, and authorities are beginning to respond.  On the face of things, ERIC is a private organization that helps its 32 member states clean up and maintain their voter rolls.  It compares state voter registration data against motor vehicle licensing information and the Social Security master death file.  Then it tells states which voters are dead, have moved out of state, or are registered to vote in more than one state.  Critics say ERIC is, at root, nothing more than a partisan get-out-the-vote drive for Democrats.   Louisiana withdrew from ERIC last month, citing ‚Äúconcerns raised by citizens, government watchdog organizations and media reports about potential questionable funding sources and that possibly partisan actors may have access to ERIC network data for political purposes.‚ÄùMore recently, Alabama left ERIC.  The new Secretary of State said he did not want a private group having access to voter data, including driver‚Äôs license numbers, contact information, and partial social security numbers including those of minors.In addition to partisan connections and privacy concerns, critics also say ERIC does a bad job, producing bloated voter rolls in member states.  Florida, for example, is a member of ERIC but has more than 100 percent of all possible citizens of voting age on its rolls.Critics point to ERIC‚Äôs initial funding which was provided by leftist super-hero George Soros.  They also point to an interlocking directorate in the person of David Becker, a high-profile Democrat election lawyer who is the architect of ERIC.  Becker started at the left-wing group People for the American Way and was part of the Obama Justice Department.  He is described as a ‚Äúhardcore Leftist‚Äù who ‚Äúcouldn‚Äôt stand conservatives.‚Äù  He went on to create the Center for Election Innovation and Research (CEIR) which distributed almost $70 million in private Zuckerberg money through official election offices to reach voters primarily in Democrat counties in the 2020 presidential election.  Becker is still a member of ERIC‚Äôs board. Lawsuits have been filed against four jurisdictions for allowing ERIC to block public inspection of voter registration records.  ERIC‚Äôs contract with states requires them to hide the information from the public, in violation of federal law, the suits allege.ERIC is also the subject of other lawsuits for sharing valuable and detailed voter registration data like phone numbers from four states with at least one outside leftist group, a practice not authorized in federal law.  ERIC requires members to identify and register unregistered voters and - this is the heart of the matter - they all turn out to be likely Democrat voters: minorities, students, etc.  According to the lawsuits, ERIC is shipping voter data to - this will sound familiar - CEIR, the leftist group I mentioned earlier involved in goosing Democrat voter registration with Zuckerbucks.  Critics say ERIC data, developed with taxpayer money, is helping the Democrats microtarget their most likely supporters who are not yet registered to vote.  Conservative activists continue to campaign against ERIC in Michigan, Virginia, and elsewhere.  However, there is a practical problem: finding a good substitute.  People suggest different things, but an obvious alternative has yet to emerge.   When ERIC was created, it displaced a then-new state-run interstate cross-check system for maintaining voter rolls.  State-run systems will be more expensive, but will pay big dividends in terms of election integrity, so they just might be the way to go.
_source.contentraw:
2/23/23 - ERIC: The Worm That Got Inside Our Elections
Links at http://www.liberato.us/commentary.html
Grassroots activists continue to raise questions about ERIC, the Electronic Registration Information Center, and authorities are beginning to respond.
On the face of things, ERIC is a private organization that helps its 32 member states clean up and maintain their voter rolls. It compares state voter registration data against motor vehicle licensing information and the Social Security master death file. Then it tells states which voters are dead, have moved out of state, or are registered to vote in more than one state. Critics say ERIC is, at root, nothing more than a partisan get-out-the-vote drive for Democrats.
Louisiana withdrew from ERIC last month, citing ‚Äúconcerns raised by citizens, government watchdog organizations and media reports about potential questionable funding sources and that possibly partisan actors may have access to ERIC network data for political purposes.‚Äù
More recently, Alabama left ERIC. The new Secretary of State said he did not want a private group having access to voter data, including driver‚Äôs license numbers, contact information, and partial social security numbers including those of minors.
In addition to partisan connections and privacy concerns, critics also say ERIC does a bad job, producing bloated voter rolls in member states. Florida, for example, is a member of ERIC but has more than 100 percent of all possible citizens of voting age on its rolls.
Critics point to ERIC‚Äôs initial funding which was provided by leftist super-hero George Soros. They also point to an interlocking directorate in the person of David Becker, a high-profile Democrat election lawyer who is the architect of ERIC. Becker started at the left-wing group People for the American Way and was part of the Obama Justice Department. He is described as a ‚Äúhardcore Leftist‚Äù who ‚Äúcouldn‚Äôt stand conservatives.‚Äù He went on to create the Center for Election Innovation and Research (CEIR) which distributed almost $70 million in private Zuckerberg money through official election offices to reach voters primarily in Democrat counties in the 2020 presidential election. Becker is still a member of ERIC‚Äôs board.
Lawsuits have been filed against four jurisdictions for allowing ERIC to block public inspection of voter registration records. ERIC‚Äôs contract with states requires them to hide the information from the public, in violation of federal law, the suits allege.
ERIC is also the subject of other lawsuits for sharing valuable and detailed voter registration data like phone numbers from four states with at least one outside leftist group, a practice not authorized in federal law. ERIC requires members to identify and register unregistered voters and - this is the heart of the matter - they all turn out to be likely Democrat voters: minorities, students, etc. According to the lawsuits, ERIC is shipping voter data to - this will sound familiar - CEIR, the leftist group I mentioned earlier involved in goosing Democrat voter registration with Zuckerbucks. Critics say ERIC data, developed with taxpayer money, is helping the Democrats microtarget their most likely supporters who are not yet registered to vote.
Conservative activists continue to campaign against ERIC in Michigan, Virginia, and elsewhere. However, there is a practical problem: finding a good substitute. People suggest different things, but an obvious alternative has yet to emerge. When ERIC was created, it displaced a then-new state-run interstate cross-check system for maintaining voter rolls. State-run systems will be more expensive, but will pay big dividends in terms of election integrity, so they just might be the way to go.

Hunter Biden‚Äôs top financial lieutenant Eric Schwerin is expected to ‚Äúsoon‚Äù provide documents to the House Oversight Committee‚Äôs investigation of the Biden family for nine violations, including money laundering and wire fraud, a spokesperson for the committee told Breitbart News.

Schwerin, who shared bank accounts with President Joe Biden and dubbed the family‚Äôs ‚Äúmoneyman,‚Äù also maintained guest lists for White House functions and negotiated the settlement with Hunter‚Äôs first wife, Kathleen. Emails from Hunter‚Äôs laptop show Schwerin was deeply embedded in Hunter‚Äôs personal life and the Biden family networks for nearly two decades and is even pictured at campaign events with Joe Biden.

Schwerin was also the president of Rosemont Seneca Partners, a fund created by Hunter Biden and several‚Äã associates that spawned business deals in Russia, Ukraine, China, and Romania. Many of those deals yielded the Biden family business millions over decades while Joe Biden was an elected official.

_source.content: China is Locking Up Future Natural Gas Supplies    by Eric Worrallhttps://wattsupwiththat.com/2023/02/22/climate-champion-china-locking-in-natural-gas-supply-deals/Thanks to the mindless Western pursuit of Net Zero, China is increasingly in a position to impose a China tax on the entire world‚Äôs energy supply, or keep the gas for themselves if they so choose.If the Chinese plan is to insert themselves into the middle, to make a profit by reselling the gas, their positioning makes sense. Man in the middle, cornering the market then forcing up prices is an old trick, which only works when there is a limited supply of something people can‚Äôt live without.The obvious counter strategy to China making themselves the natural gas brokers of the world, and potentially making a fat profit from everyone‚Äôs gas bills by pushing up the price, is to break China‚Äôs monopoly, by flooding Western markets with increased domestic gas production.But my suggested counter strategy would require a rational Western political response to energy shortages.
_source.contentraw:
China is Locking Up Future Natural Gas Supplies by Eric Worrall

https://wattsupwiththat.com/2023/02/22/climate-champion-china-locking-in-natural-gas-supply-deals/

Thanks to the mindless Western pursuit of Net Zero, China is increasingly in a position to impose a China tax on the entire world‚Äôs energy supply, or keep the gas for themselves if they so choose.

If the Chinese plan is to insert themselves into the middle, to make a profit by reselling the gas, their positioning makes sense. Man in the middle, cornering the market then forcing up prices is an old trick, which only works when there is a limited supply of something people can‚Äôt live without.

The obvious counter strategy to China making themselves the natural gas brokers of the world, and potentially making a fat profit from everyone‚Äôs gas bills by pushing up the price, is to break China‚Äôs monopoly, by flooding Western markets with increased domestic gas production.

But my suggested counter strategy would require a rational Western political response to energy shortages.

_source.contentraw:
From: http://finishtherace.com
‚ñ†Biden Admin Looking To Strip ‚ÄòReligious
Student Groups‚Äô Protections On Campus‚ñ†

In response to the growing attack on the free speech and religious liberty rights of students of faith on college campuses, the Trump administration in 2020 stepped in.

Former Education Secretary Betsy DeVos told the Washington Post that the rule protects religious students from being ‚Äúforced to choose between their faith and their education‚Äù and would also protect religious universities from being turned away for federal funding because of their religious affiliation.

Biden‚Äôs Department of Education (DOE) announced a proposal on Tuesday that would rescind a Trump-era policy that prohibited universities from receiving federal funding if they restricted religious student group activities.

The 2020 policy, initially signed by former President Donald Trump as part of an executive order in 2019, was proposed to prevent universities from censoring the speech of religious students on campus, according to the Washington Post.

The DOE‚Äôs recent announcement indicates that President Joe Biden is looking to end the policy, claiming the protections caused an ‚Äúunduly burdensome role‚Äù for the department.

_source.contentraw:
@NJP_Official I‚Äôm a day late in my summary of this great episode of NJP‚Äôs Modern Politics. But here goes:

First, some background. On Feb 3rd a Norfolk-Southern HAZMAT freight train derailed in East Palestine, Ohio, damaging and releasing the contents of 50 hydrogen chloride and phosgene cars. The governors of Ohio and Pennsylvania then approved of a 2-day ‚Äúburn-off‚Äù of the spilled chemicals, releasing tons of ultra-deadly dioxins into the atmosphere and Ohio River.

There was no immediate FEMA response. The testing of the poisoned Ohio River wasn‚Äôt conducted by federal government, but by an agency Norfolk-Southern hired to defend their corporate interests. The outrage was so wide-ranging the actions of the Ohio governors, Biden administration, and Norfolk-Southern were deplored from everyone from The Young Turks to Tucker Carlson.

On February 15th, NJP commission rep/indy journalist Joseph Jordan (pen name ‚ÄúEric Striker‚Äù) confronted Ohio Republican congressman Bill Johnson at an East Palestine town hall that night, embarrassing Johnson on camera. Following the confrontation the following ensued (this I‚Äôve taken from Mike Peinovich‚Äôs Telegram posts):

1. Ohio Governor Mike DeWine mentions FEMA for the first time, saying he is requesting aid and is being denied. For two weeks DeWine said nothing about any such conversations.

2. JD Vance shows up to poke stick in a stream.

3. Pedro Gonzalez shows up pretending he had a scoop for revealing that Norfolk Southern backed out of the town hall and says he is making a documentary.

4. Bill Johnson directly reverses what he told Striker, that this was not FEMA's job because it wasn't a tornado, and asks for FEMA aid.

5. Ohio senators JD Vance and Sherrod Brown issue a bipartisan joint request for FEMA aid.

6. Trump makes plans to show up in East Palestine.

7. FEMA says they will send aid to East Palestine.

And so here in this video Warren and Emily Balogh give you the backstory and rundown of what has since happened, as well as recent efforts on behalf of GOP figureheads DeWine and Trump to try to capitalize on the tragedy for their own political benefit‚Äîthis, when Trump‚Äôs own deregulation policies were partly responsible for Norfolk-Southern negligence, and DeWine co-authorized the calamitous burn-off with Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro.

It is becoming increasingly clear that if you are white and working class, and reside in the general rustbelt area of Ohio, Pennsylvania, and West Virginia, that you have no friends in the Republican Party‚Äîonly exploiters who themselves act on behest of rich Jewish supremacists. In contrast, groups such as the NJP and Patriot Front‚Äîconsiderably smaller than the Republican Party, and wholly without the hundreds of million$ in funding‚Äîwill do all they can to defend your interests. Remember that.

_source.contentraw:
Finally, After Woman Loses Her Legs, Missouri Politicians Begin Actions to Remove Soros-Backed St. Louis DA Kim Gardner from Office

What was it going to take before Missouri politicians began an effort to remove Soros-backed St. Louis DA Kim Gardner from office?

George Soros, who assisted the Nazis in World War II Hungary, was somehow given US citizenship and then promptly began efforts to back politicians who would support his agenda. One of his more sinister actions was to back corrupt attorneys in US cities who then promptly began ignoring crime, releasing perpetrators and making US cities less safe.

Kim Gardner in St. Louis is a Soros-backed St. Louis Circuit Attorney. She has been involved in numerous corrupt activities.

Gardner was behind the removal of former Missouri Governor Eric Greitens. She committed 62 acts of misconduct and 79 acts of false reporting in the case. Greitens resigned as governor as a result but this wasn‚Äôt enough for Gardner to resign or Missouri politicians to bring her to justice.

In September 2021, Freedom Principle begged Missouri Republican Governor Parson to remove Gardner from prosecuting felony cases based on her record. Nothing happened.

In January a former employee filed a lawsuit against Gardner and her assistant, a contract employee and convicted murderer.

Then recently Gardner‚Äôs team didn‚Äôt show up in court to enforce the law again. The repeat offender went on to hit a Tennessee volleyball player walking in St. Louis City last week ‚Äî and the young girl lost her legs after she was pinned to another car.

Finally, Missouri politicians are willing to do something about Gardner. St. Louis and Missouri residents were livid about the incident. The far-left St. Louis Post Dispatch reported:

A measure to allow the governor to name a special prosecutor for St. Louis appeared to gain momentum Wednesday in the wake of a high-profile car accident that left a visiting 17-year-old volleyball player in critical condition.

St. Louis Circuit Attorney Kimberly M. Gardner‚Äôs office has come under fire for failing to try to put the man charged with hitting Janae Edmondson back in jail even though he violated the conditions of his bond more than 50 times.

Senate President Pro Tem Caleb Rowden on Wednesday called on Gardner to step down, saying she was ‚Äúincompetent and grossly unfit to hold her office.‚Äù

‚ÄúShe should resign or I will systematically and aggressively work with my colleagues in the #MOLeg to ensure her incompetence isn‚Äôt putting more lives in danger,‚Äù Rowden, R-Columbia, said Wednesday on Twitter.

‚ÄúThe people of #STL deserve better and Missouri deserves better,‚Äù Rowden said.

This could have been avoided. It‚Äôs long past due.

group.description:
Prosecutors, What Are the Odds?
What if the Attorney General for the United States, 50 state Attorney Generals, and 1185 District Attorney Generals and all their Deputy Attorney Generals all decided to not prosecute those aiding and abetting illegal aliens?
What if they allowed a mayor to order the police to stand down in a riot?
What if they targeted patriots?
What if they targeted our President?
What if they didn't prosecute individuals, a single judge, a mayor or governor for changing voting laws without involving their legislature?
What if they allowed individuals to deny us a recount?
What if the Supreme Court of the United States of America turned their heads to voter fraud?
What if that picture of Chuck Schumer with an underage girl on Epstein Island goes unpunished?
What if Joe Biden bribing the Ukraine goes unpunished?
What if Hunter Biden selling military tech to the communist Chinese goes unpunished?
What if Hillary Clinton selling uranium to the Russians goes unpunished?
What if we went to war against Syria without a declaration of war and supported the rebels in slaughtering 600,000 people and making 6 million refugees and nobody cared?
What if we let these same people support the rebels in overthrowing Egypt and Libya? 
The same people that attacked our President, his lawyers, Flynn, Roger Stone, the same people that supported voter fraud, the same people that support pedophiles in classrooms, the people that traffic 10,000 young immigrants a year, all go unpunished by our inept or corrupt attorney generals.

There is an attorney general for every state.
Seven states do not popularly elect an attorney general. In Alaska, Hawaii, New Hampshire, New Jersey, and Wyoming, the attorney general is a gubernatorial appointee. The attorney general in Tennessee is appointed by the Tennessee Supreme Court for an eight-year term. In Maine, the attorney general is elected by the state Legislature for a two-year term.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/State_attorney_general

The District of Columbia and two U.S. territories, Guam and the Northern Mariana Islands, elect their attorneys general for a four-year term. 2014 marked the first year that the District of Columbia and Northern Mariana Islands held an election for the office. In American Samoa, Puerto Rico, and the U.S. Virgin Islands, the attorney general is appointed by the governor. In Puerto Rico, the attorney general is officially called the secretary of justice, but is commonly known as the Puerto Rico attorney general.

_source.contentraw:
Reporter who broke the tarmac story found dead:

Hoover police Lt. Keith Czeskleba said Sign's death is being investigated as a suicide, the report added.
‚ÄúOur deepest sympathy is shared with Christopher‚Äôs loving family and close friends. We have lost a revered colleague who‚Äôs indelible imprint will serve forever as a hallmark of decency, honesty and journalist integrity. We can only hope to carry on his legacy. May his memory be for blessing," ABC 33/40 Vice President and General Manager Eric Land said in a statement.

Christopher Sign.
Screen shot, courtesy of Fox News.
A report released by the Jefferson County Coroner/Medical Examiner‚Äôs Office said Sign was found unresponsive by family members at his home in Hoover, according to the Trussville Tribune.

Christopher Sign. Photo: http://ABC3340.com.
Christopher Paul Sign, 45, was found dead in his Hoover home at 8:14 a.m. on Saturday, June 12, 2021. According The report also said Sign was pronounced dead at the residence at 8:25 a.m. A cause of death has not been disclosed as of Monday evening.

Sign wrote a book about his experience called Secret on the Tarmac.


G
Sign also won a 2014 Emmy Award for breaking news for his coverage of the shooting of two Phoenix police officers, as well as an Edward R. Murrow Award for spot news, for his coverage of the search for the ‚ÄúBaseline Killer‚Äù and ‚ÄúSerial Shooter‚Äù who terrorized Phoenix in the summer of 2016.


Sign attended the University of Alabama in the 1990s and spent four years as an offensive lineman for the Crimson Tide under former coach Gene Stallings.


While at Alabama, he met his wife, Laura, an All-SEC volleyball player. The couple has three sons.

Justice Department Inspector General Michael Horowitz examined the tarmac meeting as part of a review of the FBI's emails investigation. In a report released in June 2018, Horowitz said Clinton was in Phoenix for "several campaign events, including a roundtable discussion with Latino leaders and a campaign fundraiser, and his plane was preparing to depart" when he crossed paths with Lynch, whose plane had just arrived. Horowitz also criticized Lynch for making statements that "created considerable public confusion" about her role in the emails investigation, although he said investigators found no evidence the email inquiry was discussed.
Sign told Fox News in early 2020 his family received numerous death threats since he broke the story about the meeting in the lead up to the 2016 election. "My family received significant death threats shortly after breaking this story," Sign said at the time. "Credit cards hacked. You know, my children, we have code words. We have secret code words that they know what to do."
Sign is survived by his wife, Laura, and their three sons.
Original Location: Reporter who broke story on Clinton-Lynch tarmac meeting found dead



Both Bill Clinton and Lynch claim the email investigation was not brought up during their chat, but Sign, who was a morning anchor at the Phoenix-area ABC15 when he first reported their encounter, said there was more to the story and even wrote a book about it, Secret on the Tarmac.
The book "details everything that they don't want you to know and everything they think you forgot. But Bill Clinton was on that plane for 20 minutes, and it wasn't just about golf, grandkids, and Brexit," Sign said on Fox & Friends in February 2020. "There's so much that doesn't add up."
